text: Pataugas logo Pataugas (French: splasher) is both a shoe and a brand created on 24 August 1950 by René Elissabid, an industrialist from Mauleon, a village in the province of Soule, France.http://www.pataugas.com/historique The shoe is more a boot, with a rubbered thick lugged outsole obtained with pulp rubber heated with a gas stove, hence the name "pataugas." It was the preferred shoe of generations of scouts, soldiers and hikers of all kinds, including earth tones of the various models are a sign of authenticity.http://www.pataugas.com/historique The Pataugas brand is owned today by Hopps Group. The acquisition of Pataugas was a milestone in the strategy of the manufacturer, since Pataugas is once more fashionable and manages to attract a wider audience. The French Shoe company Palladium makes a similar shoe/boot ==References== ==External links== * Pataugas official page * Vivarte official page Category:Shoes Category:Athletic shoe brands
title: Pataugas
